messageBody:
manjunath_cs99 wrote:
> hi all
>
> is it possible to write test cases for a JSP page containing only HTML
> components text box,radio buttons,check boxex and a bean in a server side
>
>
> if possible what framework helpful to write test cases
>
>
> i go through HTTPUNIT and cactus frameworks
>
> but i got so many confusions regarding testing JSP pages

These tests looks like this:

1. Use an HTTP client to request a page.
2. Parse the page into some kind of document object model.
3. Make assertions about what's on the page and in what state.

In HtmlUnit, for example:

1. Create a WebClient and invoke getPage().
2. Verify the response page is of type HtmlPage.
3. Use the HTML parsing methods on HtmlPage to look for various parts of
the page.

That should be enough to help you start.

http://htmlunit.sourceforge.net
